titles.title: A bill to delay temporarily certain regulations relating to sea turtle conservation.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Executive Comment Requested from Commerce, Interior.
Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment.
Reported to House by House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. Report No: 100-826.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Received in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 887.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment
committee.name: House Merchant Marine and Fisheries

bill.summary: 8/11/1988--Passed Senate amended. (Measure passed Senate, amended) Provides that certain regulations relating to sea turtle conservation, promulgated by the Secretary of Commerce on June 29, 1987, shall not be effective before September 17, 1988, except in the Canaveral area of Florida where they shall continue in effect.
